SiX-P4cK - (10:22): hi  
SiX-P4cK - (10:23): someone can explain me why when i create a class and add this call at one page  
SiX-P4cK - (10:23): i see "Existing documents" in my class definition  
SiX-P4cK - (10:24): but class like XWikiUsers, XWikiComments doesn't?  
SiX-P4cK - (10:24): im trying to do a live table  
SiX-P4cK - (10:25): it's work on xwikiuser but not with my own class

jbrBridge - (15:37): \* members: Eduard Moraru, evalica, James Thompson, ritsu.and.mio

sburjan\_ left at 15:38 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
sylviarusu joined #xwiki at 15:41  
cjdelisle - (15:48): Is this an invalid query?  
cjdelisle - (15:48): select prop.value from BaseProperty as prop, BaseObject as obj where prop.id=obj.id and prop.name='first\_name' and obj.name='Test.BigString'  
sburjan\_ joined #xwiki at 15:50  
cjdelisle - (15:50): I was using it to test my large string patch and it failed so I removed the patch, compiled, wiped the database and it's still failing.  
abusenius - (15:52): maybe try another name instead of prop?  
cjdelisle - (15:53): the database log looks like this:  
cjdelisle - (15:53): ERROR:  column baseproper0\_1\_.xwl\_value does not exist at character 8  
cjdelisle - (15:53): STATEMENT:  select baseproper0\_1\_.XWL\_VALUE as col\_0\_0\_ from xwikiproperties baseproper0\_ left outer join xwikiintegers baseproper0\_1\_ on baseproper0\_.......  
cjdelisle - (15:53): should be XWS\_VALUE  
cjdelisle - (15:54): (abbreviated because it joins practically the entire database in that query.)  
cjdelisle - (15:56): s/prop/property doesn't fix.  
cjdelisle - (15:56): s/prop.value/prop.name/ works but I'm testing a join query.  
abusenius - (15:57): select value from bla as prop ?  
abusenius - (15:57): (just guessing)  
cjdelisle - (15:59): from bla as prop?  
cjdelisle - (15:59): oh I see...  
sylviarusu left at 15:59 (Quit: Leaving.  
abusenius - (15:59): s/bla/BaseProperty/  
cjdelisle - (16:00): Nope, according to hibernate, that is definitely invalid. The query i posted looks like it's valid but hibernate is goofing up.  
cjdelisle - (16:03): I wonder if there is any way to make these queries any smaller?  
cjdelisle - (16:03): LOG:  execute <unnamed>: select baseproper0\_.XWP\_ID as XWP1\_17\_, baseproper0\_.XWP\_NAME as XWP2\_17\_, baseproper0\_.XWP\_CLASSTYPE as XWP3\_17\_, baseproper0\_1\_.XWI\_VALUE as XWI3\_18\_, baseproper0\_2\_.XWL\_VALUE as XWL3\_19\_, baseproper0\_3\_.XWF\_VALUE as XWF3\_20\_, baseproper0\_4\_.XWD\_VALUE as XWD3\_21\_, baseproper0\_5\_.XWS\_VALUE as XWS3\_22\_, baseproper0\_6\_.XWS\_VALUE as XWS3\_23\_, baseproper0\_7\_.XWL\_VALUE as XWL3\_24\_, case when baseproper0\_1\_  
cjdelisle - (16:03): .XWI\_ID is not null then 1 when baseproper0\_2\_.XWL\_ID is not null then 2 when baseproper0\_3\_.XWF\_ID is not null then 3 when baseproper0\_4\_.XWD\_ID is not null then 4 when baseproper0\_5\_.XWS\_ID is not null then 5 when baseproper0\_6\_.XWS\_ID is not null then 6 when baseproper0\_7\_.XWL\_ID is not null then 8 when baseproper0\_9\_.XWL\_ID is not null then 9 when baseproper0\_.XWP\_ID is not null then 0 end as clazz\_ from xwikiproperties ba  
cjdelisle - (16:04): seproper0\_ left outer join xwikiintegers baseproper0\_1\_ on baseproper0\_.XWP\_ID=baseproper0\_1\_.XWI\_ID and baseproper0\_.XWP\_NAME=baseproper0\_1\_.XWI\_NAME left outer join xwikilongs baseproper0\_2\_ on baseproper0\_.XWP\_ID=baseproper0\_2\_.XWL\_ID and baseproper0\_.XWP\_NAME=baseproper0\_2\_.XWL\_NAME left outer join xwikifloats baseproper0\_3\_ on baseproper0\_.XWP\_ID=baseproper0\_3\_.XWF\_ID and baseproper0\_.XWP\_NAME=baseproper0\_3\_.XWF\_NAME left  
cjdelisle - (16:04):  outer join xwikidoubles baseproper0\_4\_ on baseproper0\_.XWP\_ID=baseproper0\_4\_.XWD\_ID and baseproper0\_.XWP\_NAME=baseproper0\_4\_.XWD\_NAME left outer join xwikistrings baseproper0\_5\_ on baseproper0\_.XWP\_ID=baseproper0\_5\_.XWS\_ID and baseproper0\_.XWP\_NAME=baseproper0\_5\_.XWS\_NAME left outer join xwikidates baseproper0\_6\_ on baseproper0\_.XWP\_ID=baseproper0\_6\_.XWS\_ID and baseproper0\_.XWP\_NAME=baseproper0\_6\_.XWS\_NAME left outer join xwi  
cjdelisle - (16:04): kilargestrings baseproper0\_7\_ on baseproper0\_.XWP\_ID=baseproper0\_7\_.XWL\_ID and baseproper0\_.XWP\_NAME=baseproper0\_7\_.XWL\_NAME left outer join xwikilargestrings baseproper0\_8\_ on baseproper0\_.XWP\_ID=baseproper0\_8\_.XWL\_ID and baseproper0\_.XWP\_NAME=baseproper0\_8\_.XWL\_NAME left outer join xwikilists baseproper0\_9\_ on baseproper0\_.X  
cjdelisle - (16:04): That strikes me as ridiculous.  
abusenius - (16:05): you can hope that db is smart enough to optimize them  
abusenius - (16:06): or optimize them by hand  
cjdelisle - (16:06): If you know the type of property then you can.  
abusenius - (16:07): the question is how much faster it may be  
cjdelisle - (16:08): hmm. maybe "select prop.value from (select BaseProperty.classType where id=? and name=?) as prop"  
cjdelisle - (16:09): Not sure if that's valid sql.  
npm left at 16:16 (Remote host closed the connection  
cjdelisle - (16:18): Just ran the same exact query through xwql. The xwql parser made 0 change to it and passed it on to hibernate. XWQL isn't dependent on hibernate?

abusenius - (18:14): cjdelisle, do you know if hudson will find and display escaping tests after they are moved to enterprise?  
cjdelisle - (18:15): if you put them in the enterprise tests with the others (so they run when you navigate to distribution-tests and run make install) then they'll run.  
abusenius - (18:17): I don't think a new hudson project would be worth it  
abusenius - (18:18): although the total number of tests would grow from 1800 to 2600  
cjdelisle - (18:22): It wouldn't hurt to propose a new project on the list.  
abusenius - (18:23): maybe call a vote with 2 options?  
KermitTheFragger left at 18:25 (Quit: Leaving  
cjdelisle - (18:29): I think this could just be a proposal but the choice is yours.  
cjdelisle - (18:30): anyway I think a vote needs to be just +1 0 -1 otherwise it's more of a poll  
abusenius - (18:31): yea, that would be confusing
